alert.note: Alert for Kent (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 11:31AM EST until March 02 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County. .No significant precipitation is expected for the next several days so river levels are expected to slowly fall. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grand River near Comstock Park. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Abrigador Trail is underwater and minor flooding of homes occurs along Abrigador Trail and Willow Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:43 AM EST Monday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:43 AM EST Monday was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 9.2 feet early Monday morning. This forecast does not include the impact of any ice jams that may form. Ice movement has been reported in the area. If ice jams form, river levels could fluctuate quickly and greatly. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.3 feet on 03/09/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
